ChatMapperProject.Title: Feature Demo With Menu Text
ChatMapperProject.Author: Pixel Crushers
ChatMapperProject.Description: This project demonstrates the major features of the Dialogue System for Unity. This version of the project uses shorter Menu Text paraphrases and longer Dialogue Text for the player's lines.

Field.Hint: A name to reference this actor.
Field.Title: Name

Field.Hint: A collection of image files that represent this actor, used as portrait images.
Field.Title: Pictures

Field.Hint: A short description of what makes this actor unique.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: The player controls a lieutenant sent to assassinate the evil Emperor and free the star system from tyranny.

Field.Hint: Mark this box if this actor is the main player character.
Field.Title: IsPlayer

Field.Hint: A name to reference this actor.
Field.Title: Name

Field.Hint: A collection of image files that represent this actor, used as portrait images.
Field.Title: Pictures

Field.Hint: A short description of what makes this actor unique.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: The squad's technical expert, Hart refuses to kill the innocent attendees.

Field.Hint: Mark this box if this actor is the main player character.
Field.Title: IsPlayer

Field.Hint: A name to reference this actor.
Field.Title: Name

Field.Hint: A collection of image files that represent this actor, used as portrait images.
Field.Title: Pictures

Field.Hint: A short description of what makes this actor unique.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: The squad's heavy gunner, Graves wants to follow orders and kill the Emperor.

Field.Hint: Mark this box if this actor is the main player character.
Field.Title: IsPlayer

Field.Hint: A name to reference this actor.
Field.Title: Name

Field.Hint: A collection of image files that represent this actor, used as portrait images.
Field.Title: Pictures

Field.Hint: A short description of what makes this actor unique.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: The control unit that the player can use to open the hangar airlock (killing the Emperor and innocent bystanders) or re-lock it (letting them all live).

Field.Hint: Mark this box if this actor is the main player character.
Field.Title: IsPlayer

Field.Hint: A name to reference this item or quest. Use underscores instead of spaces so simulator Lua code works. Use underscores instead of spaces in Lua code.
Field.Title: Name

Field.Hint: A description of this item or quest.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: Your squad has infiltrated the evil Emperor's star carrier to assassinate him during the launch ceremony. You can liberate your star system by opening the airlock, but scores of innocent attendees will also die. Will you follow orders or abandon this opportunity?

Field.Hint: The description of the quest when the player has completed it successfully.
Field.Title: Success Description
Field.Value: With the Emperor jettisoned into space along with scores of innocent families and children, your star system is free from the Empire's tyranny.

Field.Hint: The description of the quest when the player has completed it in failure.
Field.Title: Failure Description
Field.Value: You decided that killing so many innocent people would make you no better than the Emperor himself. The rebellion will have to find another way.

Field.Hint: The state of the quest: unassigned, active, success, or failure
Field.Title: State

Field.Hint: The title of this conversation.
Field.Title: Title

Field.Hint: A short description of what happens in this conversation.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: This conversation occurs between the player and Private Hart, who refuses to open the airlock to kill the evil Emperor because a hundred bystanders would also die. This is the primary conversation in the demo. It demonstrates branching dialogue, the quest system, sequences, and QTEs.

Field.Hint: The actor who is doing most of the talking, or initiates this conversation.
Field.Title: Actor

Field.Hint: The actor who is approached or is mostly talked to.
Field.Title: Conversant

Field.Hint: The title of this dialogue.
Field.Title: Title

Field.Hint: The actor who is talking.
Field.Title: Actor

Field.Hint: The actor who is listening.
Field.Title: Conversant

Field.Hint: The text that is displayed to the player in a list as a dialogue option.
Field.Title: Menu Text

Field.Hint: The text that is spoken by the actor.
Field.Title: Dialogue Text

Field.Hint: A WMV video file to be played for this dialogue.
Field.Title: Video File

Field.Hint: The title of this dialogue.
Field.Title: Title

Field.Hint: The actor who is talking.
Field.Title: Actor

Field.Hint: The actor who is listening.
Field.Title: Conversant

Field.Hint: The text that is displayed to the player in a list as a dialogue option.
Field.Title: Menu Text

Field.Hint: The text that is spoken by the actor.
Field.Title: Dialogue Text
Field.Value: Lieutenant! We have a problem, sir!

Field.Hint: A WMV video file to be played for this dialogue.
Field.Title: Video File

Field.Hint: Dialogue System for Unity cutscene sequence
Field.Title: Sequence
Field.Value: LookAt(listener,speaker); LookAt(speaker,listener); Camera(Medium); Camera(Closeup,speaker,1)@0.1; require Camera(Closeup,listener)@2

Field.Value: We can't murder those bystanders, sir. It's not right.

Field.Title: Video File

Field.Hint: Dialogue System for Unity cutscene sequence
Field.Title: Sequence
Field.Value: Camera(Medium Right); required Camera(Closeup,listener)@3; required SetActive(Terminal inactive,false); required SetActive(Terminal active,true)

DialogEntry.UserScript: Item["Assassinate_the_Emperor"].State = "active"; Variable["Alert"] = "Mission Update: Assassinate the Emperor"

Field.Hint: Dialogue System for Unity cutscene sequence
Field.Title: Sequence
Field.Value: Camera(Medium Left,listener,0.25); Animation(TwoHandGunIButtkick,listener); Audio(Sounds/Bonecrush)@0.3; Camera(Down)@0.75; Camera(Medium,speaker,1)@0.8; Animation(HandGunIDyingback)@0.5; require Animation(TwoHandGunIdle,listener)@1; Animation(TwoHandGunFromLayingToStanding)@1.5; require Animation(PistolCombatIdle)@2; require Camera(Closeup,listener)@3

Field.Hint: The title of this conversation.

Field.Hint: A short description of what happens in this conversation.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: Sergeant Graves only barks; he doesn't hold branching conversations with the player. This conversation contains Sergeant Graves' barks. It's used by his Bark On Idle and Bark Trigger components. You could also use separate conversations for Bark On Idle and Bark Trigger.

DialogEntry.UserScript: Item["Assassinate_the_Emperor"].State = "failure"; Variable["Alert"] = "Mission Update: Assassinate the Emperor"

Field.Hint: Dialogue System for Unity cutscene sequence
Field.Title: Sequence
Field.Value: Audio(Sounds/Explosion); Camera(Shake Angle 1, Terminal active, 0.1); Camera(Shake Angle 2, Terminal active, 0.1)@0.1; Camera(Shake Angle 3, Terminal active, 0.1)@0.2; Animation(HandGunIDyingback,Private Hart); require Animation(TwoHandGunFromLayingToStanding,Private Hart)@1; Camera(Medium Left,Private Hart,1)@1; Camera(OTS Right,Player,2)@2

DialogEntry.UserScript: Item["Assassinate_the_Emperor"].State = "success"; Variable["Alert"] = "Mission Complete: Assassinate the Emperor"

Field.Hint: The name of this variable.
Field.Title: Name

Field.Hint: The default initial value of this variable.
Field.Title: Initial Value

Field.Hint: A short description of what this variable is for.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: Show alert messages during gameplay by setting this variable.

Field.Hint: The name of this variable.
Field.Title: Name

Field.Hint: The default initial value of this variable.
Field.Title: Initial Value

Field.Hint: A short description of what this variable is for.
Field.Title: Description
Field.Value: This variable can be set by a QTE in the Private Hart conversation. If set, the QTE dialogue entry is triggered.
